name: Britania Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Brittania and would stay here again if we go back to Lisbon. The staff could not do enough for us and were a credit to the hotel. We stayed in Room 63 on the top floor which had its own decked balcony (absolutely fab).
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel
reviews.title: Top Marks!

reviews.text: Julie & Adam
reviews.title: Best hotel stay in Portugal

reviews.text: to be honest, if it was possible, i would knock the score down by a half. this is only because i didn't think the breakfast choice was that great and the plates were only (cup and) saucer size but, i suppose that does help cut down on wastage.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: other than that petty complaint, everything was superb, especially the staff.
reviews.title: Fabulous Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a holiday in Europe where we stayed 4 nights at Hotel Britania in Lisbon,Portugal.I had researched this hotel on trip advisor before I booked our accomodation and found that this hotel superseeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic hotel & staff

likes.liked: — Beautifully restored art deco hotel/Outstanding service by staff/fantastic food/location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This beautiful art deco hotel was a 'shiny jewel' with impeccably high standards of service.The staff were warm,friendly and outstanding in all aspects of hospitaity.The breakfast buffet was supurb - beautifully presented fresh food with excellent variety . The location of this hotel is great - located on a quiet side street one street away from the main road Avenida Liberdade convenient for shopping and transport.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: We loved this hotel-its warm,intimacy and grandeur and rate it as one of the best hotels we have stayed in.
reviews.title: This hotel is a gem!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Britania for 4 nights at end of October. We arrived about 11.30am and our room was not ready so we were given breakfast (for free) which was a lovely gesture as we had a really early flight. Staff were great and the hotel has a great location handy to most sights. We expected Lisbon to be a nice city but we were surprised by HOW lovely it was. The old trams are just fantastic. We also did not see a cloud for 5 days and arrived back in Dublin temperature 1degree!!!!!
reviews.title: Just Fabulous!
Great Hotel Britania
reviews.text: I have just returned from eight days at Hotel Britania in Lisbon. I have stayed at countless boutique hotels in Europe and the Britania has quickly jumped to the top of my list! Not only is the property lovely...it's the last Art Deco hotel in Lisbon and has been tastefully restored.....but the staff is outstanding. Pedro, Julio and especially Raquel were so helpful and considerate. They found us restaurants, theatre tix, cabs and were so knowledgeable about the sights of the city. The hotel is sparkling clean, the rooms large and well appointed. There are wonderful public spaces and it is located just one block off the main avenida (Liberdade). Good restaurants abound in the area.

reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the Britania we felt special. The hotel is gorgeous and all the staff are a delight. Take a tip - if you are going to Lisbon, make sure you stay at this friendly, classy, very special hotel and you will not be disappointed. Floor six has amazing balconies. Floor one has a sexy Oriental feel in room 13. The style of the hotel is quite something - think of all the glamour of the 40's meets the 21st century and you are there. We had absolutely no complaints whatsoever. A joy. Thanks Britania .....and they even wrote to thank us for staying !

reviews.title: A Great Hotel
reviews.text: This was a wonderful experience. We spent five nights at the Britania and every time we returned, day and night, we were greeted by a staff equal to none , they were great in every respect. Kudos to Julio , he was knowledgeable about his city, (especially local wines ) and as kind and pleasant as could be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire staff was simply marvelous, never have come across such sincere, pleasant people. The hotel is beautiful, very Art Deco and extremely well kept. Breakfast was one of the best we have ever had in any European hotel, and the lovely woman in charge of the breakfast room was a delight. Our room was large and well designed, as was as the bathroom. On our next trip to Lisbon, which I hope will be soon,this will be where we stay.
reviews.title: Best hotel EVER

reviews.text: My husband & I stayed for 3 nights over the new year's eve. It's quiet location but walkable to the all the attractions, beautiful decor, clean & huge room, great helpfull staffs. It's 4 star hotel but was much better than some of the 5 star hotel we stayed before.
reviews.title: What a Fantatstic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for the New year period, a lovely well appointed hotel with all the rooms being renovated to the original 1942 decor, to a high standard,ours was extremely large (apparently they all are) for a city hotel and quiet!! The staff were quite superb, what a friendly helpfull bunch, they made our stay perfect and their recommendations and bookings for restaurants were spot on! If you are going to stay in Lisbon this hotel is a must!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely, very personal hotel, less happy to recommend the city

likes.liked: — The character of the hotel and friendliness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely lovely renovated art deco hotel & staffed by really nice & helpful employee's. Breakfast was great also. I do not have anything bad to say about this place, stay here if you can.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night in Lisbon i stayed at the Metropole & posted a review of that property too. There is 1 star between them but the two are worlds apart.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — The staff, the decor, the location

reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel twice in the last couple of years, it was so good the first time but we only had a night there so we returned a few months later to stay a little longer. This is a quirky Art Deco establishment very centrally located and only a few minutes from the airport bus stop, we also got an open-topped bus tour from this stop which gives a good overview of Lisbon.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: The hotel staff recommended good restaurants for lunch and for fado music in the evening, we also visited the futuristic casino and had a lovely dinner though my husband didn't think much of the gambling opportunities - just as well :-)
reviews.title: Class Always Shows

likes.liked: — Art Deco Style of the Hotel throughout.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Britania for a week at the beginning of August 2008.This is a very clean, stylish and cozy hotel. Our room was very spacious. The hotel is very conveniently located – on a quiet street, only a short walk from the center of Lisbon, also a short walk from the airport bus stop. Two members of my family got sick toward the end of the stay. The staff were then extremely helpful and understanding. Our special thanks go to Raquel, who is an exceptionally competent, friendly and congenial person. In fact, all the reception staff were helpful, kind and friendly. They all speak English. Breakfast was excellent and the waitresses were also friendly and helpful .We really felt welcome in that hotel. Many thanks to the whole staff for making our first stay in Lisbon a very pleasant and memorable experience. Next time we travel to Lisbon, we will definitely stay at the Britania.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations!

reviews.text: I chose Britania Hotel largely on it's #1 Trip Advisor rating and it is well deserved. The building is simply decorated in Art Deco style and all in good condition. The small bar and library area handles breakfast, coffee and pre/post dinner drinks well for small groups and it's generally a lovely small hotel. The people are absolutely amazing! From my desperate request for help a few days before arrival for suggestions for dinner for 6 people, to the warm welcome every time we entered the hotel and the "happy anniversary" from every member of staff (it was a birthday weekend away" complete with champagne in the room on our return from the birthday dinner, there was nothing to fault. We tried a different restaurant of their suggestion each night and all well very good - Olivier's is spectacular and a must for any visit.
reviews.title: Definately deserves #1rating

likes.liked: — art deco style with new/well kept furnishings/decorations
likes.disliked: — we were a party of 4 and no breakfast table for 4 - the did arrange once we asked

reviews.text: Given the deserved excellent reviews, I hope the hotel can maintain their standards without making the hotel inaccessible (pricewise) to people like me! The staff seemed to enjoy their jobs and pleasing their guests. Room was excellent, service superb and we enjoyed exploring Lisbon. One tip on eating out - we tried 3 small family run fish restaurants mainly frequented by locals and had some good food and service at v. reasonable prices .
reviews.title: Art Deco delight

reviews.text: Have just returned from a weekend golf break with 3 friends. We booked the Britania on the basis of the great reviews we read on this site and I have to say we were not disappointed. The staff were first class without exception and the hotel has been tastefully renovated. We also were able to avail of a great golf offer which gave us complimentary green fees at 2 local courses. Overall I would definifitely recommend this hotel - much better than a big chain in my opinion.
reviews.title: Great place for a long weekend

reviews.text: The room was extremely clean, well-appointed and huge -- the biggest we found out of 6 cities we stayed in in Spain and Portugal. The service was also top-notch -- the guys at the front desk spoke at least a dozen languages between them and were always happy to help assist in any way. The hotel is about a 15 -20 minute walk to the main sights/shopping areas. (It was pouring rain when were there in October so that felt a little longer than it might have otherwise.) It's a decent area, but not one that you really want/need to hang out in.
reviews.title: Comfortable and cool

reviews.text: There really nothing negative one can say about this place, however, for some reason, I'm a little surprised that this site ranks it the No. 1 hotel in all of Lisbon. With a ranking like that I guess I'd expect it to have a super-convenient location or be really luxurious.
reviews.title: It's All Been Said, But.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Britania was the first stop for us when we arrived in Portugal for our honeymoon. I have to say that it was the best service I've ever received at a hotel in the past. As we were only staying one night, Pedro (amazingly, helpful and accommodating) upgraded us to the suite. They even put a bottle of champagne in our room, it was so nice and we didn't expect this kind of treatment at all! The room was beautiful and very clean.
reviews.title: Britania = Brilliance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this website. If I could give them 6 stars I would, just based on the personal effort that they made to make our stay memorable. The rest of our trip was more of a backpackers/hostel type travel, but we decided to treat ourself on the first night and it was worth every penny.
reviews.title: You're in good hands at the Britania

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pedro suggested we go visit their other heritage hotel that was close the the museum (can't recall the name). It was also beautiful and had a great view.
reviews.title: Cannot fault the Britania

reviews.text: The hotel britania is marvelous, they'll go beyond your expectations.
reviews.title: A perfect experience

reviews.text: d and j
reviews.title: Well justified as number 1 in Lisbon

likes.liked: — Great location for the purpose of the trip; great rooms; staff very friendly
likes.disliked: — The views look onto a more run-down part of Lisbon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Britannia hotel for 3 nights and can say the experience of the city, location and quality of the hotel were absolutely fantastic. The staff of the hotel were some of the friendliest and most helpful that we have met anywhere around the world. We loved the way that the hotel has been kept to its original 'art deco' style, a welcome change to sterile glass and stainless steel as seen in most hotels.
reviews.title: Fantastic Britannia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found that the location was excellent, with a walk of about 10 minutes to the main square.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great staff

likes.disliked: — Their wireless Internet network wasn't working for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we rate Lisbon as one of the best city breaks in Europe.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel Britania is just right in so many respects -- it's a medium-sized boutique hotel with a beautiful Art Deco style; the staff are fabulously helpful and professional; the breakfast is great; the location is just about perfect -- central and near the Avenida de Liberdad, but off of the main drag and on a quiet street. We stayed here for five nights and wished it could have been longer.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lisbon is easily the hippest and most fun city in Europe these days, in our opinion. It just feels a lot more lively and interesting than other places that have gotten too touristy or plagued with crime or some other blight. There are so many things to see and do in Lisbon, and of course just walking around the city is the best activity there is. Our last night we got up to the Praca de Miradouro Graca for a drink on the terrace as the sun went down over the city and the river, then we hoofed it through the Alfama until we heard a fado singer in an outdoor restaurant, where we stopped for some seafood and vinho verde. What could be better?
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Very Attractive small hotel
reviews.text: This is a historical building that has been very well maintained. A small number of penthouse rooms with terraces overlooking the city were added a few years ago. We were in a penthouse room which was very well done and decorated in a modern style. My wife looked in on one of the original rooms which are decorated in a more traditional style and thought it was very nice. The public rooms are modest in size but very attractive.
This is a very nicely managed small hotel. Staff very professional and courteous. Convenient location, walking distance to everything. Would recomend heartily.
reviews.title: The high rating is deserved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a weekend in Lisbon and booked a night in this hotel based on the excellent reviews from other travellers.
reviews.title: Beautiful luxury hotel and affordable

likes.liked: — The staff were very very helpful and the overall service great

reviews.text: In short, I agree that this is an excellent hotel. The location is good (right by the luxury brand shops for those who like to shop!) and approximately a 15min stroll to the old district (or theres a metro stop right outside if you dont want to walk) and very quiet.
reviews.title: The best place ever!

reviews.text: The rooms are large, and well catered and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and all speak perfect english. The breakfast is also good based on european hotel standards. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: Vacation in Lisbon

description: Hotel Britania is a pure Boutique Art Deco hotel in the historic center of Lisbon. The only surviving original Art Deco hotel in Lisbon, with a touch of modern whimsical nuances, this small hotel is unique. With large rooms, it's located on a quiet street just off Lisbon's main avenue Avenida da Liberdade.
